summary: Test case generation app that takes Word documents of user stories and requirements as input and generates comprehensive test cases (functional, boundary, edge, exploratory, positive, and negative) with steps, preconditions, and natural execution order
architectural_notes: Document parsing: Need to extract user stories and requirements from Word (.docx) files
Test case generation engine: Must produce comprehensive test coverage across multiple categories
Test case structure: Each test case needs steps, preconditions (optional), expected results, and test type classification
Excel export: Need to generate downloadable .xlsx files containing test case data (title, precondition, steps)
known_issues: Test case names are not descriptive or meaningful
Generated test cases are missing detailed steps
Test case titles still contain garbage or non-descriptive content

existing_features.title: Implement file upload functionality that accepts Word document files (.doc, .docx) containing user stories and requirements
Display generated test cases in an organized, readable format with clear categorization by test type (functional, boundary, edge, exploratory, positive, negative)
Apply a professional, testing-focused visual design that emphasizes clarity and readability with a modern, sophisticated color scheme and clean typography
Update the TestCaseCard component to properly display the detailed test steps in the numbered format
Implement Excel file generation functionality that creates a downloadable .xlsx file containing test cases with columns for title, precondition, and steps
Add an 'Export to Excel' button in the TestCaseDisplay component alongside the existing copy and download buttons
Extend the useTestCaseExport hook (or create a new hook) to handle Excel export by integrating an Excel generation library and formatting TestSuite data into spreadsheet format

new_feature_requests.summary: Upload and parse Word documents containing user stories and requirements
Generate functional test cases with steps and preconditions
Generate boundary and edge case test cases
Include both positive and negative test scenarios
Order test cases in natural execution sequence
Parse uploaded Word documents to extract user stories and requirements text content
Generate functional test cases with detailed steps and preconditions when applicable based on parsed requirements
Generate boundary test cases that test limits and edge conditions of the requirements
Generate edge case test cases that cover unusual or extreme scenarios
Generate exploratory test cases that encourage creative testing approaches beyond specified requirements
Generate both positive test cases (expected behavior) and negative test cases (error handling and invalid inputs)
Order generated test cases in a natural execution sequence that follows logical testing flow
Generate descriptive, meaningful test case names that clearly indicate what is being tested instead of generic or unclear names
Generate detailed test steps for each test case that provide clear, numbered, actionable instructions for executing the test
Provide downloadable Excel file export of test cases including title, precondition, and steps

Update the backend test case generation logic in main.mo to ensure all test case titles are clean, descriptive, and meaningful without any garbage characters, placeholder text, or non-descriptive content
Verify that test case title generation produces semantically meaningful names that accurately reflect the test scenario based on the input requirements
